intro: Roettlera demissa, commonly known as the dwarf roettlera, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically features lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of bright blue or purple flowers. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade. Roettlera demissa is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and relatively low maintenance requirements.
